channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: Cyber agencies produce ‘long overdue’ best practices for securing Microsoft Exchange Server
item.description: Cyber agencies from three countries including the US have issued a list of security best practices for protecting Microsoft Exchange Server, a venerable on-premises email server that many IT departments still cling to.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Nvidia chief still hopes to sell Blackwell chips to China
item.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang still hopes to sell chips from the company's Blackwell lineup to customers in China, though he has no current plans to do so, he told reporters Friday.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg, The Mercury News

item.title: Hace falta una interrupción del servicio de AWS para priorizar la diversificación
item.description: A lo largo de lo años he advertido sobre los peligros de que las empresas dependan de un pequeño grupo de proveedores de nube dominantes, como AWS, Microsoft Azure y Google Cloud Platform.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Navigating Microsoft Project Online retirement: Risks, costs and strategic opportunities
item.description: Microsoft recently announced it will retire Project Online on September 30, 2026, prompting CIOs, CTOs and EPMO leaders to either rush a costly migration or modernize their processes. Those who see this as an opportunity for transformation will become more agile and better prepared for the future.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Learning from the AWS outage: Actions and resources
item.description: It has become cliché to say that the cloud is the backbone of digital transformation, but cloud outages like the recent AWS incident make enterprise dependence on the cloud painfully clear.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligenc
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: This rapid SSD moves 1GB in just seconds, and offers fingerprint security - but it'll fit right in your top pocket
item.description: This compact SSD offers rapid transfers and fingerprint access, but its limited capacity and uncertain durability curb its professional potential.
item.dc:creator: Efosa Udinmwen, TechRadar

item.title: Canva debuts foundational ‘design’ model, extends AI tools across its app
item.description: Canva has built its own foundational AI model that generates layered designs users can edit more easily. It’s one of several generative AI-related features Canva announced Thursday, alongside expanded access to its AI assistant and content generation capabilities across its app.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) — Don't be fooled by the fog machine, spooky lights and fake bats: the robotics lab at Worcester Polytechnic Institute lab isn't hosting a Halloween party.
item.dc:creator: HOLLY RAMER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Universal Music Group and AI song generation platform Udio have settled a copyright infringement lawsuit and agreed to team up on new music creation and streaming platform, the two companies said in a joint announcement.
item.dc:creator: KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Adobe AI assistants let you edit images in Photoshop and Express via prompts
item.description: Adobe is developing new generative AI (genAI) assistants that let users edit images in Adobe Express and Photoshop with written prompts. Having embedded AI-based content-generation tools across its apps in recent years, Adobe is rolling out AI assistants and agents.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Samsung’s memory ramp-up may ease AI and cloud upgrade concerns
item.description: Samsung Electronics has said it will begin mass-producing its most advanced memory chips next year to meet surging AI demand, a shift analysts say could help clear the supply bottlenecks that have slowed any cloud and enterprise network upgrades.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Google adds tiered storage to NoSQL Bigtable to reduce complexity, costs
item.description: Google has added a fully managed tiered storage capability inside its NoSQL database service Bigtable to help enterprises reduce the complexity and expenditure of storing data.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Broadcom refuses to backtrack on huge VMware price increases, claims European cloud watchdog
item.description: Broadcom is still trying to strongarm VMware customers into accepting huge price increases and onerous licensing terms, says the European Cloud Competition Observatory (ECCO) in its latest report.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Nvidia has started the $5 trillion club. A look at its rise, by the numbers
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion. The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: IBM won’t sell VMware to new cloud customers
item.description: IBM has decided not to offer VMware and VMware Cloud Foundation to new cloud customers, paving the way for it to openly pitch Red Hat OpenShift as a virtualization option instead.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Trump Media entering predictive market space
item.description: Parent company Trump Media announced a partnership to allow users to trade predictive contracts on events.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: DHS attacks Washington Post over report on misleading footage of immigration operations
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) attacked The Washington Post over a report about footage of immigration operations the outlet characterized as misleading.
item.dc:creator: Tara Suter, The Hill

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Phony AI-generated videos of Hurricane Melissa flood social media sites
item.description: One viral video shows what appears to be four sharks swimming in a Jamaican hotel's pool as floodwaters allegedly brought on by Hurricane Melissa swamp the area. Another purportedly depicts Jamaica's Kingston airport completely ravaged by the storm.
item.dc:creator: TAIMOOR SOBHAN and KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, Fox 5
